Description: Polycristalline modules consist of silicon wafer based cells that typically come in classic blue or black color. The PV cell wafers consist of multiple smaller crystals, which can show as a camouflage-like pattern on the cells. Generally, they can be colored more easily than monocrystalline cells and are slightly less expensive but also less efficient than monocrystalline cells. This type of PV is, with some exceptions, not suitable for curved applications. Customized designs (size, shape and colors) of cells and modules are possible at the expense of efficiency losses and increased costs.
ignore_Cost Notes: Cell cost is 0.24€/Wp. Total cost based on 2019 cost for installed residential system for Germany from https://ec.europa.eu/jrc/sites/default/files/kjna29938enn_1.pdf (3.3) and compared to https://www.pv-magazine.com/module-price-index/

Description: Monocristalline PV modules consist of silicon wafer based cells that typically come in classic blue or black color. It is currently the most popular PV cell technology. The cells usually have rounded corners due to production processes. Monocristalline PV modules are more efficient and also more expensive compared to polycrystalline modules. This type of PV is, with some exceptions, not suitable for curved applications. Customized designs (size, shape and colors) of cells and modules are possible at the expense of efficiency losses and increased costs.
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of poly cell of at 0.22€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono

Description: CIGS modules can be very thin, as they are not based on wafers but on deposited thin-films. This makes them flexible and suitable for applications on curved surfaces. They are of black color and modules often do not have visible spacing between cells, making a more homogeneous impression. Current modules do not reach efficiencies similar to silicon based modules and prices can still be high. The technology is expected to keep improving in the near future. Compared to crystalline silicon cells, thin-film CIGS cells show substantially lower green-house gas emissions but higher human toxicity.
ignore_module description: Standard CdTe Thin Film Attached Module
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of CdTe cell of at 1.00€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono

Description: CdTe based modules can be very thin, as they are not based on wafers but on deposited thin-films. They exist in rigid and flexible form and are usually of black color. The appearance is homogeneous as there is no spacing between cells. Efficiencies are not yet as high as for silicon based cells but improving rapidly. Compared to crystalline silicon cells, thin-film CdTe cells show substantially lower green-house gas emissions but higher human toxicity.
ignore_module description: Standard CIGS Thin Film Attached Module
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of CIS cell of at 1.75€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono

Description: Amorphous silicon (a-Si) is the non-crystalline allotropic form of the semiconductor silicon. It has a high absorption capacity and can therefore be used in solar cells with very small layer thicknesses (usually about a factor of 100 smaller than in crystalline silicon), saving on material costs and compensating for performance deficiencies caused by its comparably low industry-maximum efficiency which is about 13%.
ignore_module description: Standard a-SI Thin Film Attached Module
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of a-Si cell of at 1.00€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono

Description: HIT modules consist of silicon wafer based cells with an additional intrinsic silicon layer. From an aesthetic point of view, they are similar to monocrystalline modules showing the classic blue or black colors. The additional layer leads to an increased efficiency but also to higher cost. This type of PV is generally not suitable for curved applications.
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of HIT cell of at 0.34€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono  Base cost found here https://www.pv-magazine.com/2021/07/09/eu-spot-market-module-prices-climate-targets-pv-price-trends-for-2030-a-viable-mix/

Description: A benefit of thin film photovoltaic cells is their ability to be produced in a manner that permits flexible modules. These flexible CIGS panels can be applied to curved surfaces with ease. They are also exceptionally light and benefit from no heavy weight or carbon intensive frame.
ignore_module description: Flexible CIGS Thin Film Attached Module
ignore_Cost Notes: Additional cost per watt of cell compared to mono cell (base cost of HIT cell of at 0.34€/Wp) is added to the total BOS for Mono  Base cost found here https://www.pv-magazine.com/2021/07/09/eu-spot-market-module-prices-climate-targets-pv-price-trends-for-2030-a-viable-mix/

Description: These grey a-Si BIPV panels mimic a standard rain screen cladding system and can be configured in many shapes and sizes. While a-Si has reached a point in the market where other thin films are seen as more productive and valuable many companies still produce market-ready a-Si based BIPV products.
ignore_Cost Notes: Installed Cost from [28] https://solarchitecture.ch/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/201022_BIPV_web_V01.pdf
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Calculated from mean of South,East,West irradiance on skins ([1045+754+735]/3) for CHF applied to 470sqm of façade that yields 27000kWh-a
ignore_GWP Notes: Applies a coefficient to the GWP for standard a-Si. The coefficient is dervied from the ratio between standard CIGS and BIPV CIGS

Description: These glass-glass construction BIPV panels hold polycrystalline cells with a colored film to allow them to mimic more common building materials. This has a slight reduciton on efficiency but is often cited in reviews of BIPV aesthetics as beneficial.
ignore_Cost Notes: Install cost for CHF calculated from https://doi.org/10.1016/j.energy.2020.117935

Description: These glass-glass construction BIPV panels hold polycrystalline cells with a colored film to allow them to mimic more common building materials. This has a slight reduciton on efficiency but is often cited in reviews of BIPV aesthetics as beneficial.

ignore_Efficiency Notes: Efficiency based on coefficient applied to Steel from https://doi.org/10.1016/j.egypro.2017.07.345

Description: These monocrystalline BIPV products come in a variety of tints that make them very suitable for retrofit projects.
ignore_Cost Notes: Cost calculated based on coefficient dervied from ratio of a-Si integrated and a-Si attached (proxy for labor) applied to base monocrystalline cost
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Derived from STC on Power Rating

Description: This is a standard facade panel system based on a monocrystalline cell construction. It can be easily applied in new construction and retrofit situations.
ignore_Cost Notes: Cost calculated based on coefficient dervied from ratio of a-Si integrated and a-Si attached (proxy for labor) applied to base monocrystalline cost plus the difference between the Tinted Poly roof and façade panels (Proxy for façade install premium)
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Derived from STC on Power Rating

Description: This is a standard roof panel system based on a monocrystalline cell construction. It can be easily applied in new construction and retrofit situations.
